channel.title: Pharmapodcasts
channel.description: These are large files (mostly 10 - 20MB) which contain the slides for the lectures as well as a recording of the sound.
channel.itunes:subtitle: These are large files (mostly 10 - 20MB) which contain the slides for the lectures as well as a recording of the sound.
channel.itunes:summary: These are large files (mostly 10 - 20MB) which contain the slides for the lectures as well as a recording of the sound.

item.title: 13 Respiratory Drugs
item.description: Common problems affecting the respiratory system and the groups of drugs used to treat them. A bit on oxygen for treating hypoxia, including pulmonary oedema. The main adjunctive drugs: antitussives, expectorants, mucolytics etc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Common problems affecting the respiratory system and the groups of drugs used to treat them. A bit on oxygen for treating hypoxia, including pulmonary oedema. The main adjunctive drugs: antitussives, expectorants, mucolytics etc.
item.itunes:summary: Common problems affecting the respiratory system and the groups of drugs used to treat them. A bit on oxygen for treating hypoxia, including pulmonary oedema. The main adjunctive drugs: antitussives, expectorants, mucolytics etc.

item.title: 12 Adrenergic Transmission
item.description: An overview of adrenergic transmission in the sympathetic nervous system. Most of this stuff will be covered in more detail in the cardiovascular lectures. A bit on non-cholinergic, non-adrenergic transmission.
item.itunes:subtitle: An overview of adrenergic transmission in the sympathetic nervous system. Most of this stuff will be covered in more detail in the cardiovascular lectures. A bit on non-cholinergic, non-adrenergic transmission.
item.itunes:summary: An overview of adrenergic transmission in the sympathetic nervous system. Most of this stuff will be covered in more detail in the cardiovascular lectures. A bit on non-cholinergic, non-adrenergic transmission.

item.title: 11 Neuromuscular Junction
item.description: Drugs which cause paralysis by blocking the neuromuscular junction and why not to use them unless you know what you are doing. Suxamethonium and competitive blockers - atracurium, vecuronium and others. Uses and precautions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs which cause paralysis by blocking the neuromuscular junction and why not to use them unless you know what you are doing. Suxamethonium and competitive blockers - atracurium, vecuronium and others. Uses and precautions.
item.itunes:summary: Drugs which cause paralysis by blocking the neuromuscular junction and why not to use them unless you know what you are doing. Suxamethonium and competitive blockers - atracurium, vecuronium and others. Uses and precautions.

item.title: 10 Cholinergic Transmission
item.description: Cholinergic transmission in the autonomic ganglia and at parasympathetic nerve endings. Muscarinic receptors and their subtypes. Atropine and other antimuscarinic drugs. A bit about cholinesterases and their inhibition.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cholinergic transmission in the autonomic ganglia and at parasympathetic nerve endings. Muscarinic receptors and their subtypes. Atropine and other antimuscarinic drugs. A bit about cholinesterases and their inhibition.
item.itunes:summary: Cholinergic transmission in the autonomic ganglia and at parasympathetic nerve endings. Muscarinic receptors and their subtypes. Atropine and other antimuscarinic drugs. A bit about cholinesterases and their inhibition.

item.title: 08 Residues
item.description: Drug residues in food - how they occur and what you as a vet can do to prevent them. How to work out withholding times for drugs with some examples. Why most large-animal vets stick religiously to the instructions on the label.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: Drug residues in food - how they occur and what you as a vet can do to prevent them. How to work out withholding times for drugs with some examples. Why most large-animal vets stick religiously to the instructions on the label.
item.itunes:summary: Drug residues in food - how they occur and what you as a vet can do to prevent them. How to work out withholding times for drugs with some examples. Why most large-animal vets stick religiously to the instructions on the label.
